findings.title: approve
findings.description: The approve function has no access modifier specified.

findings.title: Transfer
findings.description: External transfer function allows users to execute transfers of a specified number of tokens to a specified address.

findings.title: transferFrom
findings.description: Allows a spender to withdraw a set number of tokens from a specified account

findings.title: permit
findings.description: The permit function has been marked as vulnerable.

findings.title: Unprotected mint Function
findings.description: The mint function is marked as external and has no access control, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Unprotected burn Function
findings.description: The burn function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized calls.

findings.title: Unprotected Swap Function
findings.description: The swapTokenForReward() function is publicly accessible and lacks proper access control, potentially allowing unauthorized users to manipulate rewards.

findings.title: Skim
findings.description: The skim function has a potential vulnerability.

findings.title: Unprotected sync function
findings.description: The sync function does not have any access modifiers and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Uninitialized Variables
findings.description: The constructor does not initialize state variables, which can lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: <Constructor>
findings.description: The constructor function has been declared public or internal without proper access control.

findings.title: Unsecured External Stake Function
findings.description: The stake function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: setInitialAddresses
findings.description: The setInitialAddresses function has an access control issue as it can only be called by the owner.
